sentences.english: In 1999, ethnic unity and progress has been exemplary Linying advanced individuals.
sentences.chinese: 1999年，获临颍县民族团结进步模范先进个人。

sentences.english: Rui Chenggang would appear to be the very model for such national image building.
sentences.chinese: 芮成钢将会成为国家形象建设的模范。

sentences.english: He is a very good husband and never runs around on his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他是个模范丈夫，从来不会瞒着妻子做一切事情。

sentences.english: They proclaimed him a model worker…
sentences.chinese: 它们宣布他为劳动模范。

sentences.english: The concept of the user model is similar to working model or a model in real life.
sentences.chinese: 模范用户的概念类似于现实生活中的劳动模范或标兵。

sentences.english: The concept of the user model is similar to working model or a model in real life.
sentences.chinese: 模范用户的概念类似于现实生活中的劳动模范或标兵。

sentences.english: Comrade Bocheng is a fine example of a tireless reader.
sentences.chinese: 伯承同志是勤读不厌的模范。

sentences.english: Carnival of Carnivals will bring together examples of carnivals from interested towns.
sentences.chinese: 狂欢节的展品可以提供给其他感兴趣的城市模范作用。

sentences.english: They co ider her a model woman.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为她是模范女子。

sentences.english: The intonation was exemplary and there was life and intensity in the musical expression.
sentences.chinese: 他们的音准堪称模范，音乐的表现力丰富而有生命。

sentences.english: At nine years old, I was the perfect student.
sentences.chinese: 九岁的我是模范学生，好学，听话，负责任。

sentences.english: The village became a real stand-out.
sentences.chinese: 这个村子后来成为了远近闻名的模范村。

sentences.english: The Paper studies the self –identity of the model workers in contemporary state-owned enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 文章研究当代国有企业工人劳动模范的自我认同状况。

sentences.english: Model workers were chosen by a show of hands.
sentences.chinese: 举手表决选出劳动模范。

sentences.english: The veteran workers and model workers are held in great esteem.
sentences.chinese: 老工人和劳动模范深受尊敬。

sentences.english: Standing by him was a model worker.
sentences.chinese: 站在他旁的是一位劳动模范。

definition: parade guards (usually spaced out along parade routes)/example/model/pacesetter
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
well qualified/competent/to be equal to the task/able to do sth very well
